issues.description: The solution’s deletePerson endpoint in PersonResource returns a ResponseEntity<Person> with HTTP 200 and a Person body, but the problem statement specifies DELETE /persons should return HTTP 204 No Content with no body. Furthermore, the client-side PersonController.deletePerson expects no body (toBodilessEntity()). This mismatch will break client-server integration and confuse students.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the deletePerson method in PersonResource to return ResponseEntity<Void> and use ResponseEntity.noContent().build() to align with the problem specification and client expectations.

issues.description: PersonResource.deletePerson calls personService.getPersonById(personId), but neither the template nor the solution’s PersonService defines a getPersonById method. This will cause a compilation error and leaves students unclear on how to retrieve a person before deletion.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a public Person getPersonById(UUID personId) method to PersonService (e.g., lookup in the internal list) or remove the need to fetch the person in the delete endpoint to resolve the missing-method error.
